hackathon-description-text: The 24 hour Diversity Hackathon is sponsored by an interdisciplinary partnership between the College of Architecture Diversity Council; College of Education and Human Development; College of Engineering, TEES; College of Geosciences; Department of Geography; TAMU GeoInnovation Service Center; College of Architecture ITS; TAMU Libraries, GIS & Maps;

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Department of Multicultural Services at TAMU
DrAL: Design Research Active Living Group
Department of Landscape Architecture and Urban Planning

hackathon-eligibility:
Texas A&M students, faculty and staff from all backgrounds and disciplines are welcome. Although not required, it is encouraged to join a team.
.
This event is part of an IRB approved study to test the Hackathon format as a new method for engaging students in the topic of Diversity in higher education institutions. IRB NUMBER: IRB2016-0061D; IRB APPROVAL DATE: 01/31/2017; IRB EXPIRATION DATE: 01/29/2018
To participate in the event, you will be asked to sign the following consent form, you may review it in advance [excerpt, full version will be provided during on-site registration]:
hackathon-requirements:
by 1pm on Saturday 18th Feb. We will circulate the sign up at 11am on Saturday via an update / email. 

: Start submitting your project early by entering what info you can on the submission form, and then save it as a draft. That way you won't be rushed toward the end. You'll be able to keep updating it until the deadline
in Geren Auditorium, Langford building B. (Not all team members need to be present during the Show&Tell)
Please note that projects will be judged on the basis of the material presented during Show & Tell.
hackathon-rules:
Please note there are no showers on site. 
We will provide plenty food, snacks and beverages. We do encourage you to bring your water bottle and utilize our Water Refill stations. 
 Organizers researve the right to change Awards, Prizes and amounts.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Challenge #1: TAMU Disability Services: Best Project
Challenge #2: Center on Disability and Development: Best Project
Challenge #3: GLBT Resource Center: Best Project
Challenge #5: TAMU Transportation Services: Best Project
Challenge #6: TAMU TAMU Engineering Experiment Station: Best Project

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Project which will show an innovative solution creatively employing knowledge and from a variety of disciplines. To be able to qualify for this Award, minimum two partners from different disciplines must be present in the team. Teams competing for this prize must state during their Final presentation what disciplines they come from and how the project benefits from their expertise.
People's Choice winner will be voted on by all participants. Please note the voting will be through Devpost - to be able to vote, you need to be registered.

Project which will imagine audacious, highly speculative, even impractical ideas or schemes for the future of TAMU campus without barriers.                                          Sponsored by Department of Geography: $250 award.

Project which will show most promise for implementation. A low-budget solution to deliver a high-impact change, erasing or overcoming accessibility barriers on TAMU campus. Sponsored by TAMU Engineering Experiment Station, College of Engineering: $250 award.
Project with the most impact for the least monetary investment. Sponsored by TAMU Engineering Experiment Station, College of Engineering: $250 award.
This award is reserved for the judges to determine on the day of the event - after the Show & Tell presentations. Sponsored by College of Architecture: $250 award.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Surprise prize TBD on the day

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Langford Architecture Bldg, College Station, TX 77840, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Barriers erased! Great response to the brief, more than the Challengers could imagine.
Great looking/sounding, great fit, great solution
The project has a potential to impact many people.

hackathon-location-address: Langford Architecture Bldg, College Station, TX 77840, USA
hackathon-description-header: Show off your creativity to improve accessibility on the TAMU campus. #TAMUDiversityHackathon
hackathon-location-description: Texas A&M University — College Station, TX
